body:
### Welcome to the W15yQC Web Accessibility Quick Check Site
The W15yQC Firefox Extension is a tool developers and Web accessibility professionals can use to check dynamically generated Web pages for common Web accessibility issues.

### Why 'W15y'?
The '15' in 'W15y' stands for the number of letters between the first W and last y in 'Web Accessibility', making W15y an abbreviation for Web Accessibility. This is in the same vein as using i18n as an abbreviation for Internationalization.

### How to Install W15yQC
1. Go to the Firefox Add-ons site for the W15yQC Web Accessibility Quick Check Firefox Extension
1. Click the "Install now" button

### How to Uninstall W15yQC
1. Open a Firefox browser window
1. Navigate on the browser menu bar to "Tools" then "Extensions"
1. Select "Accessibility Extension" with the mouse
1. Select "Uninstall" and then "OK"
1. Close all Firefox browser windows
1. The Accessibility Extension will be gone when the browser is re-opened

### Authors and Contributors
Written by Brian Richwine (@blrichwine).

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with W15yQC? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact W15yQC@gmail.com and I'll try to help you out.
name: W15yQC
